t: Importing a VM as an image - VM Import/Export
s: You can use VM Import/Export to import virtual machine (VM) images from your virtualization environment to Amazon EC2 as Amazon Machine Images (AMI), which you can use to launch instances. Subsequently, you can export the VM images from an instance back to your virtualization environment.

t: ImportImage - Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud

t: Import your VM as an image - VM Import/Export
s: After exporting your VM from your virtualization environment, you can import it to Amazon EC2. The import process is the same regardless of the origin of the VM. ... Create an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket for storing the exported images or choose an existing bucket.

t: Import images from AWS | Compute Engine Documentation | Google Cloud
s: If you have Amazon Machine Images (AMI) or a virtual disk image (VMDK or VHD) stored in a S3 bucket on Amazon Web Services (AWS), you can use the Google Cloud CLI to import these images into Google Cloud.
